step1.sentence: Instead of tackling the complex redesign first, the team decided to go after the low-hanging fruit by fixing the most common user complaints.

step2.story: The startup had a long list of improvements to make before launch. The CEO urged the team to focus on the low-hanging fruit first—small fixes that would have an immediate impact on user retention. Within a week, satisfaction scores had noticeably climbed.

step3.story: During the quarterly planning meeting, Marcus spread a list of fifty potential projects across the whiteboard. Some required months of engineering work, while others could be shipped in a single afternoon. 'Let's not overcomplicate this,' he said, circling the quick wins. 'We should grab the low-hanging fruit first and build some momentum before we go after the harder problems.' His team nodded in agreement—demonstrating early results would also help secure the next round of funding. By the end of the month, they had shipped eight small improvements that collectively reduced customer churn by twelve percent.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 나무에서 손이 쉽게 닿는 낮은 가지에 달린 과일.
meaning.realUsageKo: 비즈니스나 업무 상황에서 많은 노력 없이도 빠르게 달성할 수 있는 쉬운 목표나 기회를 가리킬 때 사용한다. 주로 우선순위 결정이나 전략 논의에서 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 과수원에서 높은 가지보다 낮은 가지의 과일을 따기가 훨씬 쉽다는 농업적 비유에서 유래했으며, 20세기 후반 비즈니스 용어로 정착되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 효율적인 접근을 강조하는 긍정적인 맥락에서 쓰이지만, 지나치게 쉬운 것만 쫓는다는 부정적인 뉘앙스로도 사용될 수 있다. 격식·비격식 모두 통용된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Automating the weekly report was low-hanging fruit that saved the team hours every month.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 주간 보고서를 자동화하는 것은 팀이 매달 수 시간을 절약할 수 있는 손쉬운 목표였다.
